p: Currently, COVID-19 has non-specific treatment. In humans, COVID-19 kicks off the respiratory system through droplets from coughs and sneezes of infected persons. Generally, respiratory system can be divided into two regions namely upper (nasal cavity, sinuses, nasopharynx, oropharynx, larynx, and trachea) and lower tract (bronchioles, alveolar ducts and alveolar sacs).Their journey to the lower respiratory tract after infecting the upper respiratory tract is the cause of respiratory illness [ 58].
